definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: I can certainly picture being ill.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定能夠想象自己生病。

sentences.english: If I overslept because I am ill, I always call in absent to work –
sentences.chinese: 如果我睡過頭是因爲我生病了，我總會打電話請假。

sentences.english: Many people take medicine when they are sick.
Chicken soup is often thought to be a healthy dish (prepared by a family member) and (given to us) when we are sick.
sentences.chinese: 雞湯常被認爲是我們生病時，家人爲我們準備的補品。

sentences.english: The old lady fusses over her little dog as if it were a sick child.
sentences.chinese: 老婦人照顧她的小狗，猶如照顧她生病的孩子。

sentences.english: His last illness almost did him in.
sentences.chinese: 上一次的生病差點讓他性命不保。

sentences.english: When his father fell ill, Tom rushed home from work.
sentences.chinese: 當爸爸生病，湯姆快速從上班的地方奔回了家。

sentences.english: Told that his mother was ill, Li Lei hurried home quickly.
sentences.chinese: 李蕾得知母親生病了時，馬上趕回了家。
生病的植物往往是退綠的。

sentences.english: The doctor gave the sick boy some medicine.
sentences.chinese: 醫生給那個生病的男孩一些內服藥。
你就是那個生病的父親。

sentences.english: First, robots never get sick, so absenteeism would be reduced.
sentences.chinese: 首先，機器人從不生病，從而曠工將會減少。

sentences.english: I didn't buy insurance and was most worried about falling ill.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有買保險，所以最擔心會生病。

sentences.english: I am ill from want of sleep.
Humans have a natural aversion to those who are ill.
sentences.chinese: 人類對於生病的人有一種天然的厭惡感。

definition: to fall ill/to contract a disease
to catch cold/(common) cold/CL:場|场[chang2],次[ci4]/(coll.) to be interested in (often used in the negative)/(Tw) to detest/can't stand
to fall ill/to be stricken with an illness
old illness recurs (idiom); a relapse/fig. to repeat an old error/the same old problem
to be in hospital/to be hospitalized
to have a high temperature (from illness)/to have a fever
